title.value: RAINPROOF: AN UMBRELLA TO SHIELD TEXT GENERATORS FROM OUT-OF-DISTRIBUTION DATA
title.justification: The title is prominently mentioned in the beginning of the paper and multiple other places throughout the text.
title.quote: RAINPROOF: AN UMBRELLA TO SHIELD TEXT GENERATORS FROM OUT-OF-DISTRIBUTION DATA

extractions.description: This paper addresses out-of-distribution (OOD) detection specifically for machine translation and dialog generation. It introduces RAINPROOF, a novel framework for OOD detection based on information projection measures. The paper also presents a new benchmark for evaluating OOD detectors in operational settings, named LOFTER.

type.justification: The paper includes extensive experiments and evaluations of the proposed OOD detection framework, RAINPROOF, against several datasets and metrics.
type.quote: Our extensive experiments on LOFTER show that OOD detectors may filter out samples...

name.justification: The paper focuses on OOD detection for text generation systems such as machine translation and dialog generation, which are core areas of Natural Language Processing.
name.quote: This paper addresses the problem of OOD detection for machine translation and dialog generation from an operational perspective.

name.justification: One of the primary applications discussed in the paper is machine translation, for which the effectiveness of OOD detection is critical.
name.quote: First, it introduces more realistic data shifts that go beyond English Fan et al. (2021): language shifts induced by closely related language pairs (e.g., Spanish and Catalan or Dutch and Afrikaans)

name.justification: Another significant application discussed is dialog generation systems, which are crucial for conversational AI.
name.quote: We study the shifts induced by Catalan-Spanish, Portugese-Spanish and Afrikaans-Dutch. Domain shifts, which occur when the model is exposed to a specific topic that was not seen during training, can also affect the quality of the translation (see Tab. 4).

name.justification: RAINPROOF is the primary framework presented in this paper for OOD detection in text generation models.
name.quote: We present RAINPROOF: a Relative informAItioN Projection Out OF distribution detector. RAINPROOF is fully unsupervised.

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces RAINPROOF as its main contribution to the field of OOD detection for text generators.
is_contributed.quote: We present RAINPROOF: a Relative informAItioN Projection Out OF distribution detector. RAINPROOF is fully unsupervised.

is_executed.justification: The experiments in the paper demonstrate the execution of RAINPROOF across multiple datasets.
is_executed.quote: Our extensive experiments on LOFTER show that OOD detectors may filter out samples

is_compared.justification: RAINPROOF is compared against several baseline methods for OOD detection.
is_compared.quote: Our results show that RAINPROOF breaks this curse and achieve good results in OOD detection while increasing performance.
